page.title: 06The Traveller's Rest
page.content:
{The Travellers' Rest}at{Meltham}was originally a farmhouse and it changed to a public house many years ago when two farmer brothers who lived there decided to brew their own beer.
An old-time publican kept a stewpan on the fire in the tap room and topped it up with anything and everything ,including dead hens killed on the road and offal from the butcher.It was said to smell delicious!!
Dotted around the wall are old price lists ;half of bitter 11d and a nip of old Arctic Barley Wine was 1s 11d.A turnip and a large hammer are to be found on the bar and customers are invited to 'bray' coins into the turnip which is then auctioned for charity.
